alert.note: Alert for Durham; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 8:46PM EDT until April 09 at 7:16AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham and Orange. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM EDT, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Durham, Chapel Hill, Carrboro, Parkwood, Bethesda, Eno River State Park, Gorman, Jordan Lake and Falls Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
